metadata.title: CVE-2022-21723 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: PJSIP is a free and open source multimedia communication library written inC language implementing standard based protocols such as SIP, SDP, RTP,STUN, TURN, and ICE. In versions 2.11.1 and prior, parsing an incoming SIPmessage that contains a malformed multipart can potentially causeout-of-bound read access. This issue affects all PJSIP users that acceptSIP multipart. The patch is available as commit in the `master` branch.There are no known workarounds.

criterions.comment: pjproject: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
